title: IPreset​
content: </> interface IPreset { ItemField: ItemField-- The ItemField class TextField: TextField-- The TextField class DropdownField: DropdownField-- The [DropdownField] class } A dictionary that contains the ItemField classes.

title: IField​
content: </> interface IField { TextField: 0 DropdownField: 1 } An enum-like table that is used to distinguish the derivative of ItemField.

title: Preset​
content: enum-like </> UIPresets.Preset: IPreset This is a enum-like dictionary that contains ItemField classes.

title: Field​
content: enum-like </> UIPresets.Field: IField An enum-like table that is used to distinguish the derivative of ItemField.

title: newField​
content: </> UIPresets.newField( itemField: Field,-- The enum item in the [Field] enum-like table ...: any-- The tuple of arguments to send to the ItemField derivative ) → T

title: Value​
content: </> TextField.Value: string This property stores the value that is inserted into the TextField.ValueField.

title: ValueField​
content: </> TextField.ValueField: TextBox  This property stores the TextBox which is used to input values into this TextField.InputField.

title: BackFrame​
content: </> ItemField.BackFrame: Frame  This property stores the back frame of all the UI elements for this ItemField.

title: InnerFrame​
content: </> ItemField.InnerFrame: Frame  This property is for maintaining the padding for the ItemField.ItemLabel and the ValueField objects.

title: ItemLabel​
content: </> ItemField.ItemLabel: TextLabel  This property is the label of the ValueField.

title: ValueChanged​
content: </> ItemField.ValueChanged: GoodSignal This property is an event that is fired when the value of the ValueField changes.

title: newBase​
content: </> ItemField.newBase() → ItemField This creates a new base object of ItemField which contains the UI elements.

title: AddValue​
content: </> ItemField.AddValue( self: T | ItemField,-- The ItemField object or a derivative valueObj: GuiObject , posOverride: UDim2? ) → () This method takes a ValueUI(GuiObject) and positions it correctly to the value place and parents it to the ItemField.InnerFrame.

title: SetParent​
content: </> ItemField.SetParent( self: T | ItemField, parent: GuiObject ) → () This method sets the ItemField.BackFrame parent to the specified parent GuiObject.

title: Errors
content: Type	Descriptioninvalid_type	This method will error if the parent is not a GuiObject.
